page.title: 07BENENDEN WEALD, SWATTENDEN
page.content: The Swattenden Centre has been in operation since 1976. Its main function is to provide for the schools of Kent an educational resource base which can be used for short-stay educational visits. Housed in a large masion house and adjacent dormitory the Centre can cater for sixty-seven visitors. The mid Victorian mansion dating from 1860 dominates the 27 acre estate which has some fine oak trees planted as the house was constructed. The grounds include playing fields which double as camping areas. Students visiting Swattenden carry out environmental studies based in and around the Wealden village of Cranbrook, farm visits and outdoor activities at Bewl Bridge and Harrison Rocks. The Kent Education Committee actively support our aims.
